events.target_title: MappingNotify event freezes drawing windows in Gnome for ~100ms

note.body:
I'm working off popos (or Pop! OS), and I've been plagued with the same issue, but this fix worked for me. For some reason the init commands have never worked on here (might be something I did), but you don't need the first one, and replacing "sudo init 5" with just a restart works just as well. 

Fantastic find Wigglyboy!


events.target_title: Update Gnome Shell extensions from the command line

note.body:
Couldn't `org.gnome.Shell.Extensions.CheckForUpdates` be used for this (defined [here](https://github.com/GNOME/gnome-shell/blame/ebf77748a8477eb712287273b4b92a8e9a189e22/data/dbus-interfaces/org.gnome.Shell.Extensions.xml#L214) and implemented [here](https://github.com/GNOME/gnome-shell/blame/ebf77748a8477eb712287273b4b92a8e9a189e22/js/ui/extensionDownloader.js#L154))?
```
dbus-send --session --print-reply --type=method_call --dest=org.gnome.Shell /org/gnome/Shell org.gnome.Shell.Extensions.CheckForUpdates
```
Unfortunately, this fails on my GNOME Shell 3.34.2 with the following error:
```
gnome-shell[4608]: JS ERROR: Exception in method call: CheckForUpdates: TypeError: Main.extensionManager.extensions is undefined
checkForUpdates/<@resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/extensionDownloader.js:157:9
checkForUpdates@resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/extensionDownloader.js:156:5
CheckForUpdates@resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/shellDBus.js:320:9
_handleMethodCall@resource:///org/gnome/gjs/modules/overrides/Gio.js:327:67
_wrapJSObject/<@resource:///org/gnome/gjs/modules/overrides/Gio.js:404:16
 ```
Currently, I'm using [this script](https://gist.github.com/N-Coder/9ec0eb11c2f14013c112e1468c708b30) (which is heavily inspired by the implementation of the "chrome-gnome-shell" daemon) to automatically click all the green update buttons and then disable unused extensions again. Of course, this probably needs a shell restart afterwards, but I usually don't want to quit all my applications (which seems to be a new thing under wayland) just for that.

events.target_title: Please watch the CanGraphical property on logind Seat objects before spawning a graphical login on a seat

note.body:
I've been hitting this bug for many months now on Arch Linux. Took me a while to get around to debugging this. Meanwhile many Arch Linux users are perpetrating [the work-around to bake KMS drivers into initramfs](https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Kernel_mode_setting#Early_KMS_start), but that's not a proper solution.

Logs: https://gist.github.com/intgr/a7eee474994e8a845405a7466ac2ebc2

Please fix, it's really disappointing to see design flaws that were known about 7 years ago bite users.

(Issue https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/10435 helped me in finding this)

events.target_title: Please watch the CanGraphical property on logind Seat objects before spawning a graphical login on a seat

note.body:
Thanks @mraudsepp, that's very helpful and solves my issue.

I created an Arch Linux bug report to integrate this patch: https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/64985

events.target_title: Build failure in DAAP plugin due to deprecated G_CONST_RETURN usage in libdmapsharing library
Build failure in DAAP plugin due to deprecated G_CONST_RETURN usage in libdmapsharing library

note.body: Hi .. the actual error message is a const error, which is in the bug description. Should this be included in the subject ?

events.target_title: Build failure in DAAP plugin due to deprecated G_CONST_RETURN usage in libdmapsharing library

note.body:
The issue is due to recent glib versions ( glib 2.62 in Ubuntu 19.10 ) which have made G_CONST_RETURN a deprecated warning. With -Werror the compilation fails. Later versions of glib have a better warning message than just a "error: const" message. 

The deprecation issue is fixed in libdmapsharing recently.

https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libdmapsharing/commit/3d79874066e1a1c1bba646135cf5fc5811b0eb55

A new release need to be pushed to fix the compiler error / warning.

events.target_title: Glib Installation Error:-  meson.build:1919:2: ERROR: Dependency "mount" not found, tried pkgconfig and cmake

note.body:
How many people are aware of equation **mean_absolute = mean \ (2^bitsPerChannel - 1)**?

Why not provide two fields for the mean values of histograms, and let users decide which units they want to use?

E.g.:
One field for standard RGB units [0 to 255].
One field for RGB units stated as [0 to 1.0].

Here is an example: http://colorizer.org

Thank you for your consideration,

Daniel Guibord

events.target_title: Saving to PDF changes text's font and size

note.body:
I have an xcf file which I've been working on for a few years using older versions of GIMP. I opened it in version 2.10.14 today and tried making a few changes, but there are a lot of problems that I'm noticing, perhaps related to this.

1) The font sizes within the file seems to be corrupted somehow. That is, a text block which was 90 px in the past, when being clicked on, is shown as 21 px. The preview is still at 90 px. But the moment I click the dragbars to resize the text layer, it immediately shrinks to 21px and then I have to change the fonts manually again.

2) When exporting to PNG, everything is fine.

3) When exporting to PDF, these problems are happening

    * The font sizes are all small.
    * Hidden layers are not omitted.


I'm attaching the latest xcf file and the old and new pdf outputs.

(Unfortunately I don't have the backup of the old xcf file)

[english-v2.pdf](/uploads/16cdd6ba593bb44a5fbd5c18a706cab5/english-v2.pdf)

[english.pdf](/uploads/3aa6bd1d9682d57f35be7d30535de061/english.pdf)

[poster1-modified.xcf](/uploads/30f0520728b158be59f8353fbf5d9ed0/poster1-modified.xcf)

events.target_title: recurrent error about tracker-extract unable inserting multiple values

note.body:
I am getting the error:

```
tracker-extract: Could not insert metadata for item "file:///home/andy/Documents/misc/second-floor-gimp.jpg": Unable to insert multiple values for subject `urn:uuid:dfa5e52c-9541-0133-831a-fa7e24eebbd6' and single valued property `nmm:exposureTime' (old_value: '0.026316', new value: '0.034483')
```

I tried running:

```
tracker reset -e -f '/home/andy/Documents/misc/second-floor-gimp.jpg'
```
That had no effect. There are over 40,000 entries in the last two days. I'm running Ubuntu 19.04.

```
libtracker-control-2.0-0/disco,now 2.1.8-2 amd64 [installed,automatic]
libtracker-miner-2.0-0/disco,now 2.1.8-2 amd64 [installed,automatic]
libtracker-sparql-2.0-0/disco,now 2.1.8-2 amd64 [installed,automatic]
libxatracker2/disco-updates,now 19.0.8-0ubuntu0~19.04.1 amd64 [installed,automatic]
tracker-extract/disco-updates,now 2.1.6-1ubuntu1~19.04 amd64 [installed,automatic]
tracker-miner-fs/disco-updates,now 2.1.6-1ubuntu1~19.04 amd64 [installed,automatic]
tracker/disco,now 2.1.8-2 amd64 [installed,automatic]
```
I saw some reference to .trackerignore. I put that in the directory. No change. It seems there was a GUI, but it does not exist in Unbuntu 19.04. The settings are very limited;all or nothing.
For now I have killed it.

Thanksm, Andy

events.target_title: file-roller looks at file extention not file header to determine type

note.body:
Another way to reproduce is to try to open a libre office PPTX (or DOCX, etc...) document.
*  keep the pptx file extension and you get the "Archive type not supported" error message,
*  rename to zip (since header 2 bytes are "PK") and file roller opens gracefully.

events.target_title: Destroys home "system" folders with cyclic symlinks
Opening png, jpeg or tiff with non-latin unicode path fails to load metadata

note.body:
Open file-png.exe and if it says "The code execution cannot proceed because **libgimpui-2.O-O.dll** was not found."
It's a typo because they should be **zeroes** not **Os**. How could someone fail at programming something simple? To avoid typing in **Os** instead of **zeroes**, use the keypad! **It's on the right side of the keyboard!** But, nope! That someone was lazy! There needs to be a keyboard that has the **zero** key **to the left** of the **one** key instead of **to the right** of the **nine** key. It needs to be intented.
